intro: Cylindrolobus warianus, commonly known as the Warianus thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and clusters of small, waxy flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slight hairy texture. Cylindrolobus warianus is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
